title: People can’t decide if this is a dog or a kangaroo on the loose in Nottingham
text:
Police in Bulwell believe a ‘kangaroo’ may have been spotted in town (Bulwell, Rise Park and Highbury Vale Police)

Police is Bulwell sparked a flurry of debate after sharing a picture of what they joked could be a ‘kangaroo’ on the loose.

Bulwell, Rise Park and Highbury Vale Police posted a picture they thought looks a bit like Skipy in the Nottighamshire town.

The post from the local police team said: ‘G’day Bulwell, this picture was taken this morning in Bulwell, I think you’re thinking what I’m thinking and I think we might be right mate.

‘There’s a Kangaroo in Bulwell and we believe she has two Joeys in tow.

‘They were seen hopping around on the old pit site this morning.

The Facebook post asking residents to be vigilant has gone viral (Bulwell, Rise Park and Highbury Vale Police)

‘So if you see Red, Skippy or Joey bouncing around near you give us a ring.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

In a reply to another comment, the police account said: ‘We’ve looked into this report and nothing’s jumping out at us – but if you see anything out back, hop to it and let us know!’

Several people were not convinced a marsupial invasion was happening, pointing out the blurry picture might have a more pedestrian explanation.

One wrote: ‘Just looks like larger than normal German shepherd peeking its head up straight from this picture.’

Readers of a local news site that seemed to be meet the picture with a healthy degree of scepticism.

One wrote: ‘Come on now have you lads been smokin the haul you confiscated the other day, or have you just gone hopping mad?’

Further complicating the debate, another wrote: ‘Bloody kangaroo, it’s a deer.

‘Absolutely loads of them all around Stapleford/trowel/strelley etc now.’

A police spokesman confirmed the picture had been sent in by a member of the public, and no officers have spotted the mystery animal.
description: Police is Bulwell sparked a flurry of debate after sharing a picture of what they joked could be a 'kangaroo' on the loose. Bulwell, Rise Park and Highbury Vale Police...
